SEARCH
Package examblock.model

Class Student

Object
Student
All Implemented Interfaces:
ManageableListItem, StreamManager
public class Student extends Object implements StreamManager, ManageableListItem
An object describing a single Year 12 Student.

  • Constructor Details

    • Student

      public Student(Long lui, String givenNames, String familyName, int day, int month, int year, String house, Registry registry)
      Constructs a new Student object with no AARA requirements by default.
      Parameters:
      lui - the student's 10-digit Learner Unique Identifier (LUI). The LUI must be unique to each student throughout the entire cohort.
      givenNames - the initial given names for the student, which must be a single string with one or more names. Names must contain only alphabetic characters, hyphens, or apostrophes; and multiple names must be separated by one or more spaces. Any leading and trailing spaces are ignored.
      familyName - the initial family name for the student, which must be a single string with one or more names. Names must contain only alphabetic characters, hyphens, or apostrophes; and multiple names must be separated by one or more spaces. Any leading and trailing spaces are ignored.
      day - the integer day of the date of birth for the student, which must be a valid day for the month and year provided.
      month - the integer month of the date of birth for the student, which must be between 1 - 12 inclusive.
      year - the 4-digit integer year of the date of birth for the student, which must be between 1965 and 2015.
      house - the initial house colour for the student, which must be one of: Blue, Green, Red, White, or Yellow.
      registry - the global registry, needed to resolve textual object names

    • Student

      public Student(Long lui, String givenNames, String familyName, int day, int month, int year, String house, Boolean aara, Registry registry)
      Constructs a new Student object with AARA requirements. Overloaded constructor for a new Student requiring access arrangements and reasonable adjustments.
      Parameters:
      lui - the student's 10-digit Learner Unique Identifier (LUI). The LUI must be unique to each student throughout the entire cohort.
      givenNames - the initial given names for the student, which must be a single string with one or more names. Names must contain only alphabetic characters, hyphens, or apostrophes; and multiple names must be separated by one or more spaces. Any leading and trailing spaces are ignored.
      familyName - the initial family name for the student, which must be a single string with one or more names. Names must contain only alphabetic characters, hyphens, or apostrophes; and multiple names must be separated by one or more spaces. Any leading and trailing spaces are ignored.
      day - the integer day of the date of birth for the student, which must be a valid day for the month and year provided.
      month - the integer month of the date of birth for the student, which must be between 1 - 12 inclusive.
      year - the 4-digit integer year of the date of birth for the student, which must be between 1965 and 2015.
      house - the initial house colour for the student, which must be one of: Blue, Green, Red, White, or Yellow.
      aara - the initial aara setting for the student, true or false: true requires AARA adjustments, false does not.
      registry - the global registry, needed to resolve textual object names

    • Student

      public Student(BufferedReader br, Registry registry, int nthItem) throws IOException, RuntimeException
      Constructs an Exam by reading a description from a text stream
      Parameters:
      br - BufferedReader opened and ready to read from
      registry - the global object registry, needed to resolve textual Subject names
      nthItem - the index number of this serialized object
      Throws:
      IOException - on any read failure
      RuntimeException

  • Method Details

    • sanitiseName

      public String sanitiseName(String text)
      Return a string from the input string complying with the following rules
      • a single string with one or more names.
      • names must contain only alphabetic characters, hyphens, or apostrophes
      • multiple names must be separated by one or more spaces.
      • any leading and trailing spaces are ignored
      Parameters:
      text - the string to sanitise
      Returns:
      the sanitised string

    • streamOut

      public void streamOut(BufferedWriter bw, int nthItem) throws IOException
      Used to write data to the disk.

      The format of the text written to the stream must be matched exactly by streamIn, so it is very important to format the output as described.

      1. LIAM ALEXANDER SMITH
      LUI: 9999365663, Family Name: Smith, Given Name(s): Liam Alexander, Date of Birth: 2007-12-08, House: Blue, AARA: false
      Subjects: Essential English, Essential Mathematics, Ancient History, Industrial Technology Skills, Trade Course, Another Trade Course
      Specified by:
      streamOut in interface StreamManager
      Parameters:
      bw - writer, already opened. Your data should be written at the current file position
      nthItem - a number representing this item's position in the stream. Used for sanity checks
      Throws:
      IOException - on any stream related issues

    • streamIn

      public void streamIn(BufferedReader br, Registry registry, int nthItem) throws IOException, RuntimeException
      Used to read data from the disk. IOExceptions and RuntimeExceptions must be allowed to propagate out to the calling method, which co-ordinates the streaming. Any other exceptions should be converted to RuntimeExceptions and rethrown.

      For the format of the text in the input stream, refer to the streamOut documentation.
      Specified by:
      streamIn in interface StreamManager
      Parameters:
      br - reader, already opened. Y
      registry - the global object registry
      nthItem - a number representing this item's position in the stream. Used for sanity checks
      Throws:
      IOException - on any stream related issues
      RuntimeException - on any logic related issues

    • changeLui

      public void changeLui(Long lui)
      Change the LUI of the student.
      Parameters:
      lui - the student's 10-digit Learner Unique Identifier (LUI). The LUI must be unique to each student throughout the entire cohort.

    • setGiven

      public void setGiven(String givenNames)
      Sets the given names of the student.
      Parameters:
      givenNames - the new given names for the student, which must be a single string with one or more names. Names must contain only alphabetic characters, hyphens, or apostrophes; and multiple names must be separated by one or more spaces. Any leading and trailing spaces are ignored.

    • setFamily

      public void setFamily(String familyName)
      Sets the family name of the student.
      Parameters:
      familyName - the new family name for the student, which must be a single string with one or more names. Names must contain only alphabetic characters, hyphens, or apostrophes; and multiple names must be separated by one or more spaces. Any leading and trailing spaces are ignored.

      public Boolean isAara()
      Returns true if this student is an AARA student. (i.e. the student requires Access Arrangements and Reasonable Adjustments).
      Returns:
      true if this student is an AARA student, false otherwise.
